content.raw:
Maybe, but after doing some tests today we think that any force control or feedback for damping compensation should be done around 1000 - 10000 Hz, which is not feasible with the current control approach. Especially if the signals are even a little bit noisy and my feeling is that the force torque sensors are extremely noisy.

The high damping parameters basically break our walking controller. Could a solution be that the damping of the PID controllers or the kp_velocity is implemented using the CFM constraint mixing (with a certain reasonable minimum and maximum), such that teams that use full body force control can set the damping to low values?
